env.name: VERSION
env.label: Dokku version
env.description: Version of Dokku to use ('latest' if empty)

env.name: DOKKU_HOSTNAME
env.label: Dokku hostname
env.description: Global hostname to be registered by Dokku

env.name: VOLUME_PATH
env.label: Dokku volume path
env.description: Host path to be bound to /mnt/dokku (`/var/lib/dokku` if empty)

env.name: DOKKU_HOST_ROOT
env.label: Dokku host root
env.description: Image build cache path. Generally set to <data dir> + '/home/dokku'

env.name: SSH_PORT
env.label: SSH port
env.description: Host port to expose SSH port of Dokku (22 if empty)

env.name: HTTP_PORT
env.label: HTTP port
env.description: Host port to expose HTTP port of Dokku (80 if empty)

env.name: HTTPS_PORT
env.label: HTTPS port
env.description: Host port to expose HTTPS port of Dokku (443 if empty)

templates.title: Telegraf
templates.description: Telegraf is an agent for collecting metrics and writing them to InfluxDB or other outputs.
templates.note: Telegraf is an open source agent written in Go for collecting metrics and data on the system it's running on or from other services. Telegraf writes data it collects to InfluxDB in the correct format.

templates.title: InfluxDB
templates.description: Scalable datastore for metrics, events, and real-time analytics
templates.note: InfluxDB is an open source time series database with no external dependencies. It's useful for recording metrics, events, and performing analytics.

env.name: INFLUX_PORT
env.label: HTTP Port
env.description: Exposed port of the HTTP API.

env.name: INFLUXDB_DB
env.label: Database name
env.description: Automatically initializes a database with the name of this environment variable.

env.name: INFLUXDB_ADMIN_USER
env.label: Admin user name
env.description: The name of the admin user to be created. If this is unset, no admin user is created.

env.name: INFLUXDB_ADMIN_PASSWORD
env.label: Admin user password
env.description: The password for the admin user configured with INFLUXDB_ADMIN_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.

env.name: INFLUXDB_USER
env.label: Database user name
env.description: The name of a user to be created with no privileges. If INFLUXDB_DB is set, this user will be granted read and write permissions for that database.

env.name: INFLUXDB_USER_PASSWORD
env.label: Database user password
env.description: The password for the user configured with INFLUXDB_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.

env.name: INFLUXDB_READ_USER
env.label: Read-Only user name
env.description: The name of a user to be created with read privileges on INFLUXDB_DB. If INFLUXDB_DB is not set, this user will have no granted permissions.

env.name: INFLUXDB_READ_USER_PASSWORD
env.label: Read-Only user password
env.description: The password for the user configured with INFLUXDB_READ_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.

env.name: INFLUXDB_WRITE_USER
env.label: Write-enabled user name
env.description: The name of a user to be created with write privileges on INFLUXDB_DB. If INFLUXDB_DB is not set, this user will have no granted permissions.

env.name: INFLUXDB_WRITE_USER_PASSWORD
env.label: Write-enabled user password
env.description: The password for the user configured with INFLUXDB_WRITE_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.

env.name: CONFIG_REPO
env.label: Repository URL
env.description: URL pointing to the git repository containing configuration data.

env.name: CONFIG_BRANCH
env.label: Repository branch
env.description: Repository branch.

env.name: GIT_USER
env.label: Git User
env.description: Username to authenticate against the remote repository.

templates.title: Cloud9
templates.name: Cloud9
templates.note:
Portainer App Templates by Technorabilia based on data provided by LinuxServer.io.

Don't forget to create the volume directories on the host file system.

mkdir -p /volume1/docker/cloud9/config
mkdir -p /volume1/docker/cloud9/code
templates.description: [Cloud9](https://github.com/c9/core) Cloud9 is a complete web based IDE with terminal access. This container is for running their core SDK locally and developing plugins.

templates.title: Lidarr
templates.name: Lidarr
templates.note:
Portainer App Templates by Technorabilia based on data provided by LinuxServer.io.

Don't forget to create the volume directories on the host file system.

mkdir -p /volume1/docker/lidarr/config
mkdir -p /volume1/docker/lidarr/music
mkdir -p /volume1/docker/lidarr/downloads
templates.description: [Lidarr](https://github.com/lidarr/Lidarr) is a music collection manager for Usenet and BitTorrent users. It can monitor multiple RSS feeds for new tracks from your favorite artists and will grab, sort and rename them. It can also be configured to automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available.

templates.title: Ombi
templates.name: Ombi
templates.note:
Portainer App Templates by Technorabilia based on data provided by LinuxServer.io.

Don't forget to create the volume directories on the host file system.

mkdir -p /volume1/docker/ombi/config
templates.description: [Ombi](https://ombi.io) allows you to host your own Plex Request and user management system. If you are sharing your Plex server with other users, allow them to request new content using an easy to manage interface! Manage all your requests for Movies and TV with ease, leave notes for the user and get notification when a user requests something. Allow your users to post issues against their requests so you know there is a problem with the audio etc. Even automatically send them weekly newsletters of new content that has been added to your Plex server!
